text: Amir Ganiel (January 6, 1963 â€“ May 14, 2018) was an Israeli swimming champion and record holder in swimming. He was part of the in the World Championships in Berlin for the national team. He worked in long distance. He was called one of the greatest Israeli swimmers. He became a surgeon, after his swimming career. Ganiel was born and died in Jerusalem. ==References== Category:1963 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Jewish Israeli sportspeople Category:People from Jerusalem Category:Surgeons Category:Swimmers
